item.title: About me
item.description: I manage the day-to-day running of ‘The Shed’, an open access workshop which provides a rapid prototyping facility for the School of Computing and the University of Kent. My skills include: rapid prototyping and design, conducting qualitative research, user-centered design, programming in C and developing ‘Internet of Things’ applications.

item.title: Education
item.description: PhD in Computer Science As a member of the Computing Education Research Group, in the School of Computing, my research focuses on student engagement with disciplinary practices. BSc in Computer Science (1st class) The course covered a variety of modules including the study of: Java, C, Algorithms, Embedded Micro-Systems and Intelligent Systems. Developing Management Skills Programme A professional development course in management skills that took place over 6 months. Topics included: effective team leadership, dispute resolution and project management.
